q: Mirafiori vote had implications far beyond the limits of Turin. Business leaders say a decision by Mr Sergio Marchionne not to invest in Italy would have had devastating effect on already low foreign direct investment in Italy. Turnout was very high because people know this is a vote about the future of Italy, said Eros Panicali, secretary-general of the Uil union movement which had backed Mr Sergio Marchionne 's plan. Human Rights Watch head Kenneth Roth said that Obama had clearly sided with democracy but that it was not until Zine El Abidine Ben Ali "was basically out the door" that France took sides. The EU, the US and others learned a lesson, he added. Western nations had long supported the Tunisian leader, seeing him as a bulwark against Islamic militants in the region. In 2006, then-US defense secretary Donald Rumsfeld , speaking in Tunis,

Robert Gerald Ford , who produces the show with his wife Michelle, said he wanted Donald Rumsfeld to appear as a witness in a lawsuit, testifying about why aggressive interrogation techniques like water-boarding are sometimes needed during wartime. It's an episode about moral relativism about what is considered torture and what is not, Robert Gerald Ford said. But Keith Urbahn, who works for the former defense secretary, said the idea rules Donald Rumsfeld out. "This area is so fraught with legal ramifications," Urbahn said

Idol was the biggest thing anyone had seen since, well, the Spice Girls. And just days after the season finale in 2002, it was announced that Idol was heading to America-with its star judge. We had seen footage and of course we knew for sure that Simon Cowell had to be there, says Mike Darnell , Fox's head of alternative entertainment.
